name: Cheesy Ravioli with Tomato Sauce
keywords: Cheesy Ravioli with Tomato Sauce, Tomato, Dinner, Ravioli, Cheese, Pasta, Prosciutto, Ricotta Cheese, Blue Cheese, Parmesan Cheese, Basil, Homemade Pasta, Stuffed Pasta, Italian, Comfort Food, Date Night, One-Pan
description: Delicious cheese-filled ravioli served with a light tomato sauce. A comforting pasta dish.

recipeInstructions.text: Place flour on a table and form a well in the middle. Beat eggs and salt, then place in the well. Gradually mix the flour into the eggs until it forms a shaggy ball of dough. Knead the dough for 10-15 minutes until elastic and smooth. Wrap in plastic wrap and chill in the fridge for an hour.
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare Dough

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, mix all of the filling ingredients together.
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare Filling

recipeInstructions.text: Fry the prosciutto until crispy. Set aside. In the same pan, fry the onions until soft, then add the tomatoes, garlic, thyme, salt, and pepper. Simmer until the sauce thickens. Add water if needed. Stir in the crispy prosciutto and basil.
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Roll out the pasta dough using a pasta roller. Cut into evenly spaced squares. Place filling in the middle of half the squares and cover with the other half. Press down the sides firmly to seal.
recipeInstructions.name: Assemble Ravioli

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook the ravioli in batches for 3-4 minutes or until al dente. Drain and mix with the tomato sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook Ravioli

recipeInstructions.text: Plate the ravioli with some sauce and sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese and basil leaves.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

notes: For a richer flavor, try using a mix of different cheeses in the filling.
This dish can be made ahead of time and baked in the oven when ready to serve.
